findings.title: C1: Profit & loss accounted twice when unwinding
findings.description: Profit and loss are accounted twice when a swap is unwound due to a logic error in the calculateSwapUnwindValue function of IporSwapLogic library, leading to incorrect profit and loss calculation.

findings.title: H1: Unwinding formula
findings.description: The difference formula in IporSwapLogic library does not differentiate between pay fixed and receive fixed swap kinds, leading to incorrect profit & loss value calculation.

findings.title: M1: INTEREST_FROM_STRATEGY_BELOW_ZERO reverts
findings.description: The functions updateStorageWhenWithdrawFromAssetManagement and updateStorageWhenDepositToAssetManagement in the AmmStorage contract are responsible for updating the liquidity pool and asset management balances when withdrawing from asset management or depositing to asset management. Whenever calling one of the functions, the balances are also updated with the interest received from Aave and Compound. In both functions, there is a check that the interest earned since the last update is non-negative.

findings.title: M2: Inaccurate hypothetical interest formula
findings.description: The IPOR protocol uses continuous compounding when computing an interest, but the hypothetical interest value is computed from an average interest rate without considering continuous compounding, leading to an insignificant error between real and computed hypothetical interests.

findings.title: M3: Pool contribution is not updated when liquidity is redeemed
findings.description: The mapping `_liquidityPoolAccountContribution[account]` is not updated when liquidity is withdrawn by calling the `redeem` functions, leading to incorrect contributions being returned and allowing accounts to deposit less and less liquidity after every redeem till no deposit is allowed.

findings.title: M4: Incorrect event data
findings.description: The contract AmmPoolService emits an incorrect event where the beneficiary address is used instead of the msg.sender address, which can lead to incorrect tracking of liquidity providers and complicated postmortem hack analysis.

findings.title: L1: Value in incorrect decimals
findings.description: The variable `wadAmmTreasuryErc20BalanceBeforeRedeem` is acquired using `IERC20.balanceOf`, resulting in asset-specific decimals, but it's used as an argument of the `calculateRebalanceAmountBeforeWithdraw` function which expects all parameters in wads.

findings.title: L2: Liquidation deposit accounted twice in rebalancing logic
findings.description: The liquidation deposit is added to the final transfer value when the swap buyer closes the swap, but it's already included in the transfer amount, resulting in accounting for it twice in rebalancing logic.

findings.title: L3: Aave incorrect APY formula
findings.description: The `StrategyAave` contract does not take into account interest compounding when computing the estimated APY, making it incomparable with the APY computed by `StrategyCompound`, leading to an indirect loss to the liquidity pool.

findings.title: L4: Close swap and redeem transaction reverts
findings.description: Multiple edge case scenarios can cause a close swap or liquidity redeem transactions to revert due to insufficient liquidity in the AMM treasury and rebalance must be performed, specifically with liquidation deposit not accounted into transfer amount when closing a swap.

findings.title: W1: Usage of solc optimizer
findings.description: The project uses `solc` optimizer which may lead to unexpected bugs and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: W2: SoapIndicatorRebalanceLogic underflow
findings.description: The `SoapIndicatorRebalanceLogic` re-calculates the average interest rate when opening and closing a swap, which may result in an underflow if there were previously opened swaps with zero interest rates.

findings.title: Interest from Strategy Below Zero
findings.description: In AmmStorage contract, functions updateStorageWhenWithdrawFromAssetManagement and updateStorageWhenDepositToAssetManagement may revert due to negative interest computation caused by rounding errors or different decimals of Compound tokens and underlying tokens.
